intro: Senecio santanderensis, commonly known as the Santander groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Colombia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
